document.topic_text: Authorities search for fugitive wanted for felonious assault WKYC 11:34 AM. EST April 25, 2016 Fugitive Jose 'Tito' Cortes. CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN GOOGLE+ PINTEREST The U.S. Marshals' Northern Ohio Violent Fugitive Task Force are asking for the public's help in locating a fugitive. Authorities said Jose 'Tito' Cortes Jr. is wanted on felonious assault charges by both the U.S. Marshals and the Independence Police Department. The 26-year-old man beat a woman on April 5, according to officials. He also allegedly used an iron to burn her in multiple places. The victim sustained such bad injuries that she needed to seek medical attention. Cortes is described as being 5'11" and weighing 190 pounds. Authorities said Cortes is believed to be on the West Side of Cleveland. He should be considered to be armed and dangerous. Anyone with information related to the case should call the task force at 1-866-4-WANTED or text 'WANTED' to 847411.
